title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon R9 200 Series (HAWAII, DRM 3.19.0, 4.14.72-1-lts, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Experienced crackling audio exclusive to this application and had problems with my controller (XbOne) constantly rotating the camera until I remapped via Steam. Otherwise runs at comparable speeds to my Windows installation.
title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

notes:
This game works very well on Linux/Steamplay.
I met only one problem: with my x360 gamepad, the camera spinning around my character. 
You can easily resolve this bug: 
- open the file config.ini located in
/home/yourprofilname/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/367500/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/Local Settings/Application Data/CAPCOM/DRAGONS DOGMA DARK ARISEN/
- change this two lines as this:
MAP_RSTICK_VERT=RX
MAP_RSTICK_HORZ=RY
That'all, now enjoy playing this games on Linux :D
title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

notes:
Starting game with controller plugged in results in behaving like 2-to-4 controllers are vying for Player One. Simple menu navigation was terribly frustrating. Tried disabling all controllers through Proton's Wine Control, yet the game still behaved as both an Xbox 360 controller AND my Xbox One controller simultaneously... in-game options reflected as much.

SOLUTION: remap entire gamepad controls as KB/M through Steam's controller configuration, then start the game with the controller UNPLUGGED--only plug it back in AFTER the initial boot. Definitely playable thereafter.

Inconsistent FPS--goes from smooth 60fps to dipping as low as 12fps in town. Still an enjoyable game!
title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

notes: Crashes roughly 3 secs after selecting "New game" was not able to fix it
title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

notes: Perfectly stable even during long gaming sessions. Only issue is the frame rate which can dip down to low 20s. Still perfectly playable with no hanging or crashing.
title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

notes: Works great performance and graphically wise, couldn't get the xbox UI to stick, each time I touched a button on my Xbox360 usb controller it reverted to the generic USB button UI. Problem seems to exist on Windows too.
title: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen

notes:
Played the intro and walked around the first village. While it's ok during intro, frame rate drops to 15-25fps (didn't find any fix for now). I also had to disable all joypads to be able to play with my Xbox360 wired pad (WINEPREFIX="/home/STEAM-DIR/proton/steamapps/compatdata/367500/pfx"
wine control)
